author: Staff Reporter
text:
The Mettupalayam police arrested S. Gopal alias Gopalakrishnan (39) of Kumarapuram on Annur Road in Mettupalayam, on Friday, for allegedly stabbing his brother-in-law S. Sasikumar (38) with a knife, on Thursday night. The police said that the two were neighbours and the accused borrowed Rs. 100 from the victim about a week ago. On Thursday night, Sasikumar asked Gopal to return the money when the later who was in an inebriated condition stabbed Sasikumar. The victim was admitted to Coimbatore Medical College Hospital (CMCH). Gopal was booked for attempt to murder.

Boy found dead in well

An eleven-year-old boy from Kulathupalayam near Kuniyamuthur, who went missing from his house on February 7, was found dead in a 60-feet-deep well in that locality on Thursday. According to the police, the boy was not regular to school and used to catch pigeons in wells. On the day he went missing, his mother V. Kaliyammal (30) scolded him and asked him to go to school. He left the house and did not return. His body was retrieved from the well with the help of Fire and Rescue Services personnel.

Sentenced

The Fourth Additional District Judge of the Coimbatore Court on Friday convicted two persons and sentenced them to five years imprisonment as they were found guilty of possessing counterfeit currencies to the tune of Rs. 19,500.

The police said that Mayilsamy (50) and Rahuman (56), both from Salem, had 39 notes in the denomination of Rs. 500 in their possession when the police checked them at the Ukkadam Bus Stand on January 1, 2014, when they came from Palakkad.
title: Held for attempt to murder
